content.question: In which of the following ways do political parties primarily rely on to finance their election activities?

choices.label: Parties rely primarily on tax revenue.
By winning elections, parties are able to fund government programs they care about.
Parties sell posters, stickers, buttons, and other products.
Parties solicit funds from private donors who oftentimes contribute large sums of money.

content.answer: Parties solicit funds from private donors who oftentimes contribute large sums of money.

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Explain political principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
